item.description:
Our July monthly meeting features a return visit from Andrew Schneider, the executive director of the ACLU of Connecticut.

Andrew will speak on “The Clients: A Look at the Sacrifices of Individuals Who Make the ACLU’s Work Possible,” telling the gripping stories of ACLU clients in three major cases involving voter suppression; separation of church and state; and the challenge of Arizona’s “show me your papers” anti-immigration laws.

We'll start with thirty minutes of coffee and conversation at 7:30 p.m. The talk will follow brief announcements at 8:00 PM.
item.how_to_find_us: We will most probably be in the Social Hall near the main entrance.
item.name: Monthly Meeting: Three Major Civil Liberties Cases, Three ACLU Clients
